context: West Papua was a Dutch colony until 1962. Indonesia invaded in 1963 and annexed it through a fraudulent 'Act of Free Choice' in 1969 where only 1,026 hand-picked Papuans were allowed to vote under military coercion. The indigenous Papuan population has faced genocide, with estimates of 100,000-500,000 killed since 1963.

military_installations.name: Kodam XVII/Cenderawasih Headquarters
military_installations.notes: Main Indonesian military command for Papua region. Coordinates counterinsurgency operations.

military_installations.name: Sentani Air Base
military_installations.notes: Major Indonesian Air Force base used for military operations and troop transport.

military_installations.name: Biak Naval Base
military_installations.notes: Indonesian Navy base controlling maritime access to Papua.

military_installations.name: Timika Military Base
military_installations.notes: Protects Freeport mine, site of numerous human rights abuses.

military_installations.name: Wamena Military Post
military_installations.notes: Controls access to Central Highlands, site of repeated massacres.

military_installations.name: Merauke Military Base
military_installations.notes: Southern Papua base, involved in transmigration program enforcement.

massacres.name: Biak Massacre
massacres.description: Indonesian forces opened fire on peaceful independence demonstrators raising the Morning Star flag. Bodies were loaded onto ships and dumped at sea.
massacres.notes: Eyewitness accounts describe torture, rape, and execution of prisoners. Many bodies never recovered.

massacres.name: Wamena Massacre (2019)
massacres.description: Violence erupted after racist abuse of Papuan students. Security forces and Javanese settlers attacked Papuans.
massacres.notes: Part of broader 2019 uprising across Papua following racist incidents in Java.

massacres.name: Paniai Lakes Massacre
massacres.description: Soldiers opened fire on crowd protesting earlier beating of Papuan youths by military.
massacres.notes: One of many documented shootings of unarmed protesters.

massacres.name: Wasior Massacre
massacres.description: Police counterinsurgency operation resulted in extrajudicial killings, torture, and village destruction.
massacres.notes: Rare case where Indonesian human rights court investigated (2013).

massacres.name: Wamena Massacre (2000)
massacres.description: Military attacked pro-independence rally, killing civilians and burning homes.
massacres.notes: Part of broader crackdown on independence movement after 1999 Timor referendum.

massacres.name: Mapenduma Hostage Crisis
massacres.description: Military 'rescue' operation resulted in deaths of hostages and villagers, followed by reprisals.
massacres.notes: Operation was cover for military operations against OPM.

massacres.name: Tembagapura Killings
massacres.description: Aerial bombardment and ground assault on villages near Freeport mine during OPM uprising.
massacres.notes: One of the largest single massacres, largely undocumented due to media blackout.

resource_extraction.name: Grasberg Mine (Freeport-McMoRan)
resource_extraction.notes: World's largest gold mine, second largest copper mine. Has generated over $50 billion in revenue. Indigenous Amungme and Kamoro peoples displaced. Indonesian military provides 'security' paid by Freeport - documented human rights abuses.
resource_extraction.environmental_damage: Massive tailings dumped into rivers, destroying ecosystems over 230 sq km

resource_extraction.name: BP Tangguh LNG
resource_extraction.notes: Major LNG project operated by BP. Indigenous communities displaced without adequate compensation.

resource_extraction.name: Merauke Integrated Food and Energy Estate (MIFEE)
resource_extraction.notes: Massive land grab for palm oil and food production. Over 2.5 million hectares targeted, displacing indigenous Malind people.

resource_extraction.name: Logging Concessions
resource_extraction.notes: Vast logging operations have destroyed millions of hectares of rainforest, displacing indigenous communities dependent on forests.
resource_extraction.environmental_damage: Papua has one of highest deforestation rates in Indonesia

transmigration_settlements.name: Arso Transmigration
transmigration_settlements.notes: Part of systematic program to move Javanese settlers to Papua, reducing indigenous majority.

transmigration_settlements.name: Merauke Transmigration
transmigration_settlements.notes: Large-scale settlement of Javanese in traditional Malind territory.

transmigration_settlements.name: Timika Transmigration
transmigration_settlements.notes: Settlements to support Freeport mine labor needs.

transmigration_settlements.name: Jayapura Transmigration
transmigration_settlements.notes: Capital city area heavily settled with non-Papuans.

restricted_zones.name: Central Highlands
restricted_zones.notes: Foreign journalists and NGOs effectively banned. Military operations ongoing against OPM.

restricted_zones.name: Nduga Regency
restricted_zones.notes: Since 2018 massive military operation displacing over 45,000 people.

political_prisoners.name: Filep Karma
political_prisoners.charges: Treason for raising Morning Star flag
political_prisoners.notes: Leading political prisoner, arrested for peaceful flag-raising. Released after 11 years.

political_prisoners.name: Victor Yeimo
political_prisoners.notes: Spokesperson for West Papua National Committee (KNPB), arrested during crackdown.

historical_events.name: New York Agreement
historical_events.description: Netherlands ceded West Papua to UN administration, then to Indonesia, without Papuan consent.
historical_events.notes: Agreement made between colonial powers over the heads of Papuans.

historical_events.name: Act of Free Choice (Act of No Choice)
historical_events.description: Fraudulent referendum where only 1,026 hand-picked Papuans voted under military coercion to join Indonesia.
historical_events.notes: UN supervised but did not validate. Known to Papuans as 'Act of No Choice' (Pepera).

historical_events.name: OPM Formation
historical_events.description: Free Papua Movement (OPM) founded to resist Indonesian occupation.
historical_events.notes: Has waged low-level armed resistance for over 50 years.

historical_events.name: Morning Star Flag Declaration
historical_events.description: Morning Star flag first raised as symbol of West Papuan independence under Dutch.
historical_events.notes: Raising the flag remains illegal under Indonesian law, punishable by 15 years prison.

historical_events.name: 2019 West Papua Uprising
historical_events.description: Largest protests in decades following racist abuse of Papuan students in Java.
historical_events.notes: Indonesian military deployed, internet cut, hundreds arrested.
